medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset of right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced acute RUQ pain that started about 10 hours prior to presentation, following a small meal and yoga session. She had been experiencing vague RUQ discomfort for the past few weeks, with exacerbation of her GERD symptoms. After the acute pain onset, she also had emesis of her meal. The epigastric pain resolved, but the RUQ pain persisted leading her to seek further evaluation.
